@BZo1480 I believe Saori said she also had a miscarriage since she said she had  "terminations" as she said, probably abortions of the other pregnancies she had and it did not allow her to properly carry this last baby from Kana's husband. Meanwhile, Kana's child died from premature birth complications.

Part 6: Kana just probably wanted to live in the moment and run away from all her life's pain and choices through sex and not confront any of it. Her mind became so muddled and "poisoned" as  she said that she could not function properly anymore until reality hit her hard. But to finally see a sound resolution between Kana and her husband, after all the difficulty, their return to each other was very real and believable to me as a reader and it almost felt earned to a degree. Would have liked to see Kana and Saori reconnect as well, but the main couple finding reconciliation was strong enough for me and the split between Saori and her husband made the most sense since too much hatred and spite had infected their relationship, so it only seem natural to divorce. Really glad to see and NTR end on a good not, in a realistic enough fashion and some good story overall with the writing and making the characters interesting.
@hentaitiger Kana had the miscarriage. Saori's baby was born and Kana wonders to herself how it's doing since she doesn't go to the flower shop anymore and presumably stopped talking to her.

Part 5: To finish, the premature death of Kana's child and the revealed infidelity to everyone, I was glad to see it was not a simple ending to happily ever after, but Kana and her husband dealing with the emotional fall out of all that had happened. Consequences are finally met, and her husband does not even talk with her, adding to her loneliness once more. But once he took his co-worker's words to heart and after losing the child he was about to have with Saori through miscarriage, he realized he wanted to build back his marriage with Kana and finally have a family with her. I still had difficulty figuring out Kana's dialogue, especially during the shower scene, Was not sure if she actually was having feelings towards Saori's husband, or it was simply just the rush of emotions and stress she was dealing with back home that warped her sense of reality and feelings towards all the people around, as she said that she did not care for her husaband, Saori, nor Saoris husband either.

Part 4: I genuinely found Saori's husband's motivation more interesting since it was not just a sexual desire he had like in most NTRs, but just a desire to get back at Saori for what she did. I don't believe neither Saori nor husband were right, since we know so little about their relationship, but it can be said that they were both the catalysts of the story and share the blame for the dysfunction in their relationship. But what I also liked were the consequences of their actions, such as Kana getting pregnant and her husband ignoring her out anger since he did not want kids at the time. And her attempt at aborting the child herself was also quite wild, something I had not seen before in any other story, since she still loved her husband and did not want to burden him with the child, especially one that was not his. Then to finalize it was the reveal of it all at the end. Pretty morbid considering all that was laid bare to see.

Part 3: Saori's marriage was definitely an interesting add on to the story since it was because of her infidelity that lead to her husband becoming this revenge seeking rapist who only assaulted Kana and all other workers as a way to get back at Saori for having cheated on him in the past, and this is especially emphasized when we see he cannot cum while having sex normally, but instead pounds her face during the blowjob, almost as a way of treating her like a sex toy, and not a partner. I still feel the author could have explored their relationship a bit more to see whether or not Saori's infidelity was done out of just boredom, or because her relationship with her husband was also suffering so she sought our comfort else where. But we do see her desires return when she decides to sleep with Kana's husband I believe after her discussion with her own husband about not having kids since she was busy with the new shop opening.

Kana's motivation and involvement in the ordeal was a little difficult to accept, especially in the beginning, with going back to Saori's husband after the first rape, it was difficult for me to understand why she would enjoy it, but considering that it is explained in the beginning of the story that she was not fully satisfied sexually with her husband, I gave it the benefit of the doubt. Plus, the arguments she would get into with her husband regarding children definitely seemed like something they would argue about before in the past, even before his demotion at work. So in a way, there was some distance being formed between Kana and her husband emotionally speaking about family. Then came the sexual thrill with Saori's husband that sent her off the rails into the debauchery. Even Kana's husband would not perform as well during certain moments before her return to the shop, by going to sleep quickly and not wanting to do it raw, but always have a condom on to prevent pregnancy.

Part 1: Definitely feel that was one of the better written NTR/cheating stories we have had. The ambiance and mood set around the whole act really pulled me in during the story. I read the whole thing through, without fap, guess I was tire of fapping to sad NTR stories but this one was different because there was lots of cause and effect sequences laid out for the reader to understand the motivations of the characters. Although I would say that there could have been some extra filler pages to explain certain sequences, but most things were generally well explained and there were some serious emotional and physical consequences that we don't typically see at the end of these types of stories.

Ayy that was dramatic af. Shit was good and all but it was lacking something. Dunno if it's the art style, lack of sex scenes, or the melancholic monologue being destroyed with the word "semen" or "womb", or the lack of deep, sexy, dramatic words in general. 6/10 I only fux with the story line.
